meanings.definition: Instruct orally, typically by asking questions
meanings.sent1: The teacher will catechize the students on the new math concept.
meanings.sent2: She decided to catechize her little brother on how to tie his shoes.
meanings.sent3: During the game, the coach tried to catechize the players on the new strategy.
meanings.sent4: The parent had to catechize the babysitter on the bedtime routine.
meanings.sent5: The expert was able to catechize the audience on the complex topic in a simple way.

meanings.definition: Teach the principles of Christian religion by means of questions and answers
meanings.sent1: The priest will catechize the children on the Ten Commandments.
meanings.sent2: Every Sunday, the pastor catechizes the congregation on the Bible stories.
meanings.sent3: The nun decided to catechize the parrot on the Lord's Prayer.
meanings.sent4: The missionary traveled to catechize the remote village on Christianity.
meanings.sent5: The catechist was able to catechize the new members of the church effectively.
